Still, the Artificer's words echo. Across the gap, Andor, Tatsumaki, and Ayla have made it to the top of the dirt cliff, and are resting, watching, or examining their wounds. A distance away, you see Aelriss, sitting, useless, at the center of a fairy-ring of scorched earth and burned vegetation.

“For some of us, it might be too late for that. Ascheritte? What do you think?” Kainzo glares at you, prodding Velika's body with his sword to indicate the Celestial Gem in her brooch. He speaks with condescension. “We were close to victory, and on the verge of death. But, you wanted that, didn't you?”

You did.
